name: places/ChIJ6SGU8yb2wokRmPVa0OGGWD4
formattedAddress: 150 W 100th St, New York, NY 10025, USA
adrFormatAddress: 150 W 100th St, New York, NY 10025-5145, USA

originalText.text:
My daughter Diane and I love our neighborhood library so much. We come to our library every day after school. The free tutoring teachers work sincerely and diligently in guiding our children's after-school classes. I praise them with sincere respect and gratitude. All library staff are friendly and do their best in their respective positions. I wish there were more books and support at my local library, which many babies, children, and students use. We pride ourselves on having the best after-school classes and teachers in New York City. Thank you, my dear teacher Samantha, Sam and Rosa.
You make me a better mother . :)

originalText.text:
This library is located just steps away from the NYPD NO.24 Precinct, it provides a sense of security and easy accessibility for those who might be concerned about their personal safety. The library spans two floors, on the upper floor, I found a vibrant child after-school area. The cozy reading nooks, colorful furniture, and a vast collection of children's books make it an inviting space for kids to explore the world of literature.

One of the standout features of this library is its commitment to maintaining a tranquil and conducive environment for reading and studying. Despite its proximity to the bustling city streets, the library is remarkably quiet. It's the ideal place for individuals looking to escape the chaos of the city and immerse themselves in the world of literature.

Furthermore, the library's restrooms are not only clean but also conveniently located (Upper floor). The availability of easily accessible bathrooms is often an overlooked but essential aspect of any public space.

originalText.text: This library is okay, there are more beautiful and bigger ones in the city but this one is cozy and has everything you need including the internet and computers and books of course and clean restroom. it's located pretty good not far from the central park

originalText.text:
I am truly grateful to my kid’s teachers who are so helpful to immigrant families like ours.
We come to the library every day after school to study and play with our teachers. Thank you.

All teachers ( they have 4 teachers) are very passionate and truly love and teach their students. Thank you beautiful today teacher Samantha~ :)

originalText.text: On Monday, it should open at 10 a.m, but they often don't open until 11a.m without any notice, except for a notice posted on the door, so there will be many people waiting at the door. Most of the staff are very friendly, except for the black security guard at the door (who doesn't have a security uniform) who clearly lacks vocational training.
